author: butta
content:
> the same investment will give me roughly k block per year in pow
does not really work, because miners usually mine through pools

author: butta
content: you can use https://proposalprobab.web.app/ to calculate the block probability on pos though

author: pietjepuk
content: and with staking, block proposal rewards are only a fraction of total rewards

author: potuz
content: Still this is a number that is relatively easy to compute at least to give an order of magnitude, cost of hash power should be public (say to rent) blocks per hash power as well.  Same for PoS, expected blocks per ETH invested, add in proposal rewards in average, And now you have expected block  rewards per ETH invested. I do suspect that MEV makes probably a big difference cause in pos you're guaranteed to know in advance when you have several blocks in a row and this opens new doors
